question_text: You are approaching another vessel and are not sure whether danger of collision exists. You must assume ______.

choices.choice_text: there is a risk of collision
the other vessel is the give-way vessel
there is no risk of collision

question_text: You are in restricted visibility and hear a fog signal forward of the beam. Nothing appears on your radar screen. You must ______.

choices.choice_text: sound two prolonged blasts of the whistle

question_text: While underway at night you observe a vessel's range lights in line off your starboard beam． You should ______.
Where does the look-out man stand？ ______.

choices.choice_text: In positions in which the noises in the ship are least likely to interfere with the hearing of a fog signal and the man can see clearly．
In positions in which the noises in the ship are much likely to interfere with the hearing of a fog signal．
In positions in which the hearing of a signal is reduced to a minimum．
In a position in which the man can see clearly．

question_text: When your vessel enters thick fog，she should sound ______ every two minutes in accordance with these Rules．
When you doubt the existence of risk of collision，______.

choices.choice_text: such risk shall be deemed to exist
such risk shall not be deemed to exist
you needn't take any action to avoid collision with any vessel
you should accelerate your speed ahead．

question_text: When two power-driven vessels are meeting on reciprocal or nearly reciprocal courses so as to involve risk of collision，they shall be deemed to be in ______.
When in sight of another vessel，any action taken to avoid collision must ______.

choices.choice_text: not result in another close quarters situation

question_text: When a vessel sees the other ahead or nearly ahead，by night she could see the masthead lights of the other in a line or nearly in a line or both side lights，______ shall be deemed to exist．
In determining safe speed，all of the following must be taken into account EXCEPT the ______.

choices.choice_text: presence of background lights at night

question_text: In determining if risk of collision exists，if there is any doubt，such risk shall be deemed to ______.
In determining a safe speed ______ shall not be among those taken into account．

choices.choice_text: the characteristics，efficiency and limitation of the radar equipment
any constraints imposed by the radar range scale in use
the effect on radar detection of the sea state，weather and other sources of interference．
the safe working load of the cranes both on board and ashore．

question_text: In determining a safe speed ______ shall not be among those taken into account．

choices.choice_text: the presence of the background light at night
the state of wind，sea and current
the number of crew on board
the draught in relation to the available depth of water．

question_text: In determining a safe speed ______ shall not be among those taken into account．
In dense fog a vessel without operational radar may not be justified ______ at all but should anchor if it is safe and practicable for her to do so．
In complying with the Rules，of what must the mariner take due regard? ______.

choices.choice_text: Limited backing power of his vessel
The occupation of the other vessel，if known

question_text: In a crossing situation，the stand-on vessel should normally ______.

choices.choice_text: take action to cross ahead of the other vessel
take action to pass astern of the other vessel

question_text: In a crossing situation，a stand-on vessel which is forced to take action in order to avoid collision with a vessel on her own port side shall，if possible，avoid ______.
If the circumstances of the case admit，any vessel ______ in a narrow channel．

choices.choice_text: shall have the liberty to anchor
shall moor to a buoy when necessary

question_text: If the circumstances admit，______ of small alteration of course and speed shall not be taken to avoid collision．
If a vessel of special construction cannot fully comply with the Rules，her degree of compliance shall be determined by ______.
If a vessel is engaged in fishing according to the definitions in the Rules，it will have ______.

choices.choice_text: gear extending from the side or stern

question_text: If a seaplane is not used as a means of transpiration on water but is capable of being used so，it shall ______.

choices.choice_text: be regarded as a vessel not under command
be regarded as a vessel underway
be regarded as a sailing vessel．

question_text: Which statement about the Navigation Rules is TRUE? ______.

choices.choice_text: The rules require vessels to comply with Traffic Separation Scheme regulations.
The rules use the term safe speed.
The Rules permit a stand-on vessel to take action prior to being in extremis.
All of the above are correct.

question_text: The Rules state that vessels may depart from the Rules when ______.

choices.choice_text: there are other vessels in the vicinity
operating in a traffic separation scheme
engaged in a situation involving more than two vessels

question_text: Vessels，______ support vessels，should not enter the safety zone of a deepwater port unless clearance has been obtained from the Vessel Traffic Supervisor．
One of the factors which affects the circulation of ocean currents is ______.
A head-on situation at night is one in which you see ______.

choices.choice_text: one sidelight of a vessel ahead of you
one sidelight and a masthead light of a vessel ahead of you
one sidelight，a masthead light，and a range light of a vessel ahead of you
both sidelights of a vessel dead ahead of you

question_text: A proper look-out must be kept ______.

choices.choice_text: only between the hours of sunset and sunrise
only when entering and leaving port

question_text: A proper look-out shall be maintained ______.

choices.choice_text: at night and during restricted visibility

question_text: A vessel ______ a crossing vessel，shall not normally enter a separation zone or cross a separation line．

A vessel aground at night is required to show two red lights in a vertical line as well as ______.

choices.choice_text: restricted in her ability to maneuver lights

question_text: A vessel approaching a narrow channel shall ______.

choices.choice_text: avoid crossing the channel if it impedes another vessel navigating in the channel
not overtake any vessels within the channel
keep as close as possible to the edge of the channel on her port side

question_text: A vessel approaching your vessel from 235°relative is in what type of situation? ______.

choices.choice_text: Sidelights and a small white light at each end．
A small white light at each end．

question_text: A vessel being towed astern shall show at night ______.

choices.choice_text: the lights required for a power-driven vessel underway

question_text: A vessel being towed will show ______.
A vessel conducting mine clearing operations will show ______.

choices.choice_text: three balls in a vertical line
two balls in a vertical line
one ball near the foremast and one ball at each fore yard
one diamond near the foremast head and one ball at each fore yard

question_text: A vessel constrained by her draught may，in addition to the lights prescribed for power-driven vessels in Rule 23，exhibit where they can best be seen ______ or a cylinder．

choices.choice_text: two all-round red lights in a vertical line
three all-round red lights in a vertical line
two all-round yellow lights in a vertical line
three all-round green lights in a vertical line．

question_text: A vessel continually lists to one side and has a normal rolling period. Which statement is TRUE? ______.

choices.choice_text: The center of gravity is on the centerline.

question_text: A vessel crossing a river on the Western Rivers has the right of way over ______.

choices.choice_text: all vessels ascending and descending the river

question_text: A vessel enagaged in fishing，and at anchor，shall show ______.

choices.choice_text: three lights in a vertical line，the highest and lowest being red，and the middle being white

question_text: A vessel engaged in fishing during the day would show ______.

A vessel engaged in fishing shall keep out of the way of a vessel ______.

choices.choice_text: restricted in her ability to maneuver

question_text: A vessel engaged in mine clearance operations is called ______.

choices.choice_text: a vessel restricted in her ability to maneuver

question_text: A vessel engaged in trawling will show identification lights of ______.

choices.choice_text: a red light over a white light
a white light over a red light
a green light over a white light

question_text: A vessel may exhibit lights other than those prescribed by the Rules as long as the additional lights ______.

choices.choice_text: do not interfere with the keeping of a proper look-out
are not the color of either sidelight

question_text: As look-out，you spot an object 45°off your port bow. You should report the object as ______.

choices.choice_text: 3 points forward of the port beam

question_text: You are advised to enter the traffic route at about 1730 hours，because a vessel is scheduled to enter at the time when you intended to enter．What can you understand from this seaspeak？ ______.

choices.choice_text: It's a warning of navigation for my vessel．
It's an advice from Port Control to order my vessel not enter the traffic route of the harbor．
It's an advice to change my estimated time of entering the traffic route．

question_text: Which of the following statements is (are) correct regarding ship handling when in the vicinity of Traffic Separation Schemes？ ______ ① A vessel shall，so far as practicable，avoid crossing traffic lanes． ② If obliged to cross traffic lanes，shall do so as nearly as practicable at right angles to the general direction of traffic flow．

Which of the following is (are) correct regarding ship handling when in the vicinity of traffic separation schemes？ ______ ① Normally join or leave a traffic lane at the termination of the lane． When joining or leaving from the side you shall do so at as large an angle to the general direction of the traffic flow as practicable． ② A vessel shall，so far as practicable，avoid crossing traffic lanes，but if obliged to do so shall cross as nearly as practicable at right angles to the general direction of traffic flow．

choices.choice_text: the promotion of the traffic flow

question_text: The rule regarding look-outs applies ______.
If obliged to cross traffic lanes，a vessel shall do so on a heading as nearly as practicable ______ to the general direction of traffic flow．

A vessel when joining or leaving from the side of a traffic separation scheme shall do so at as ______ to the general direction of traffic flow as practicable．

choices.choice_text: either small or large an angle
neither small nor large an angle．

question_text: A vessel using a traffic separation scheme shall so far as practicable ______ a traffic separation line or separation zone．

choices.choice_text: proceed through an inappropriate traffic lane

choices.choice_text: enter the traffic separation zone in an emergency．
engage in fishing in the separation zone．

choices.choice_text: to engage in fishing within the zone

question_text: You may ______ traffic lane．
